poem:
### Morning Headlines
   
Awake to another world of paper,  
where invisible hands fly drones,  
and nations play in the sandbox of treaties.  
Names stack up—Nabatieh, Gaza,  
lines blurred between dawn and diplomacy.  
Somewhere a pen signs a pact,  
while shadows trace the routes of the dead.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Middle East crisis live: More than 60 killed in Israeli strikes in Gaza 10.44am BST Media in Lebanon reports that an Israeli drone targeted a car in the country’s southern Nabatieh region. 10.38am BST William Christou in Beirut has this report on Donald Trump’s latest round of diplomacy in the Middle East, where the US president has urged Syria to join the Abraham Accords and normalise its relations with Syria. Related: Trump meets Syria’s president". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Middle East crisis live: More than 60 killed in Israeli strikes in Gaza 10.44am BST Media in Lebanon reports that an Israeli drone targeted a car in the country’s southern Nabatieh region. 10.38am BST William Christou in Beirut has this report on Donald Trump’s latest round of diplomacy in the Middle East, where the US president has urged Syria to join the Abraham Accords and normalise its relations with Syria. Related: Trump meets Syria’s president
